articles.title: Is An 'AI Apocalypse' Rapidly Approaching?

articles.title: Opinion: Customer service today: Expect less, pay more — with complications throughout
articles.author: Pamela Pommer
articles.summary: Customer service is about making it easier for people to afford their products by offering easy-to-use sale prices and discounts and maintaining human contact when we check out. In the good old days, we'd see a sign in the grocery store that read '2 for $7' and it meant that you could just buy one item and pay the sale price of $3.50. Now, Target has adopted pricing displays that advertise, for example, 2 for $10 in large print with 'when you buy 2' much smaller. Cub often makes it easy to get sales prices by using the Cub card that it scans. Lunds no longer mails out its weekly sales brochure

Only 9% said no.

In a decade it will be too late to put the brakes on any of this.

Bartkus died in the blast, while four others were left injured by the explosion.

articles.title: AI blackmail and more

articles.summary: When I need a break from worrying about senile public officials, insane economic policies and jaw-dropping grift at the highest levels, I soothe my mind by worrying about the inevitability of AI. articles.title: AI Will Devastate the Future of Work. But Only If We Let It

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is coming for virtually every job category, but it will be a long time before machines are crawling under sinks or threading wires through walls. Voice actors are watching their profession vanish as AI models can generate natural-sounding voices at a fraction of the cost. Illustrators face the same fate, while a reliance on AI to develop video games has led to widespread layoffs in that sector.

Amazon promised to minimize waste through less carbon emissions and traffic as a result of the new AI.

The investment will also support thousands of other jobs in the Amazon Web Services data center supply chain.

Reddit is a social media platform and aggregation site where users can engage in a variety of topics, pose questions and get answers from other users. Reddit has already been using AI via Google and OpenAI for it's Reddit answers section.

articles.title: PromptQL Partners with UC Berkeley to Develop New Data Agent Benchmark for Reliability of Enterprise AI Agents
articles.author: Prompt QL
articles.summary: PromptQL, a platform for reliable AI, announced a strategic research collaboration with the University of California, Berkeley to develop the first comprehensive data agent benchmark for enterprise reliability specifically designed to evaluate general-purpose AI data agents in business-critical environments. The benchmark is based on data from telecom, healthcare, finance, retail, and anti-money laundering to reflect the real complexity of enterprise AI.

articles.title: AMC Networks partners with AI startup Runway
articles.author: Staff Writer
articles.summary: AMC Networks is partnering with AI startup Runway to use AI tools for marketing and developing its TV shows. Runway's AI technology will help AMC Networks ease access to standout scenes for promotional use. The tech will also be used to speed up 'pre-visualization' during development, which is when studios use images to plan scenes before filming takes place.

articles.title: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Bets Big on Swiss AI With $400M Cloud Investment
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) will be investing $400 million in Switzerland to develop its cloud computing and artificial intelligence infrastructure. The company currently employs up to 1,000 people in Switzerland. The money will be used to expand and upgrade its data centers near Geneva and Zurich.

articles.title: Meta Platforms (META) Touts AI Skills as Key to Wage Growth, Eyes Bigger Role in Workforce Transformation
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: On June 2nd, Citizens JMP analyst Andrew Boone reiterated a Market Outperform rating on Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:META) with a $750.00 price target. The analysts pointed out the importance of artificial intelligence (AI) skills in the workforce, citing Meta's claim that workers having AI-related skills could help boost their wages by up to 20%.

articles.title: Apple Inc. (AAPL) to Show Off Incremental AI at WWDC, Analysts Temper Hype
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: JPMorgan reiterated an Overweight rating on Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) with a $240.00 price target. JPMorgan recently published a list of 10 AI Stocks on Wall Street's Radar. Apple is going to use the Developers Conference to showcase its expanded AI capabilities.

articles.title: Tesla (TSLA) Doubles Down on U.S. Battery Independence, Sidesteps China Supply Chains
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: On June 3rd, Piper Sandler analyst Alexander Potter reiterated an Overweight rating on Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) with a $400.00 price target. Tesla is an automotive and clean energy company that leverages advanced artificial intelligence in its autonomous driving technology and robotics initiatives.

articles.title: AI-driven search ad spending set to surge to $26 billion by 2029, data shows
articles.author: Jaspreet Singh
articles.summary: Spending on AI-powered search advertising is poised to surge to nearly $26 billion by 2029 from just over $1 billion this year in the U.S. Google and Microsoft's Bing have added AI capabilities to better compete with chatbots such as OpenAI's ChatGPT and Perplexity AI. Apple is exploring integration of AI-driven search capabilities into its Safari browser.

articles.title: State legislators are pushing for artificial intelligence companies to take root in Pa.
articles.author: Evan Robinson-Johnson
articles.summary: Pennsylvania is competing with the rest of the country and the world in the race to house critical AI infrastructure and claim the jobs that come with it. State Sen. Greg Rothman wants to establish a 'Commonwealth Opportunity Zone' to expedite approvals for development. Pittsburgh's AI strike team wants to create 100,000 tech jobs by 2028.

articles.title: Scientists Create an Artificial Eye That Could Give AI Human-Like Sight
articles.author: Studyfinds Staff
articles.summary: Japanese researchers have created an artificial eye that mimics human vision. The self-powered device uses dye-sensitized solar cells to distinguish colors with high precision. It can recognize motion and color with up to 82% accuracy thanks to its ability to produce both positive and negative electrical responses based on light input. The technology could lead to ultra-efficient machine vision systems for use in autonomous vehicles, wearable health monitors and remote sensors.

articles.title: What is vibe coding? A computer scientist explains what it means to have AI write computer code
articles.author: Chetan Jaiswal
articles.summary: Andrej Karpathy, an OpenAI co-founder who previously led AI efforts at Tesla, coined the term "vibe coding" to describe the process of writing computer programs. It's a way of writing code based on feelings rather than explicitly defined information. It saves time and lowers the skills required to code, but there are trade-offs.

articles.title: Trump budget bill would ban AI regulation. What Americans think of that in poll
articles.author: Brendan Rascius
articles.summary: A majority of Americans are against a provision in the latest congressional spending bill that bans states from regulating artificial intelligence development for a decade. The bill is now being considered in the Senate and is expected to be delivered to Trump's desk by early July. The Common Sense Media/Echelon Insights survey found widespread concern about forcing states to sit on the sidelines as AI advances.

articles.title: Revolutionizing Job Applications: How AI-Powered Resume Builders Are Changing the Game
articles.author: Sponsored Post
articles.summary: Seven in ten employers expect algorithms to guide recruiting by 2025. The once-tedious résumé has evolved into a dynamic handshake between human ambition and machine speed. AI engines digest oceans of job descriptions, industry jargon, and recruiter feedback. They recognize hiring trends the same way music apps predict your next favorite song.

articles.title: Republican legislators voice support for public funding in AI research
articles.author: Alexandra Kelley
articles.summary: Todd Young and Mike Rounds spoke at the AI + Expo in Washington, D.C. on Tuesday and Wednesday. They support government investment in artificial intelligence research and development. They also support light-touch regulatory approach that leading policymakers, including Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick and White House Office of Science and Technology Policy Director Michael Kratsios, have publicly supported.

articles.title: Amazon to invest $10B in North Carolina toward AI data centers
articles.author: Thomas Barrabi
articles.summary: Amazon will invest $10 billion toward new artificial intelligence data center infrastructure in Richmond County, North Carolina. The project is expected to create at least 500 new high-skilled jobs, including data center engineers and network specialists. Amazon has invested $12 billion in the state since 2010 and plans to spend $100 billion on capital expenditures this year.

articles.title: CMOs Plan Big Investments In AI For The Next Three Years
articles.author: Megan Poinski
articles.summary: According to Boston Consulting Group's survey, 71% of CMOs plan to invest more than $10 million annually in AI over the next three years. Worry about AI has fallen to 23% among CMO's, half of what it was two years ago. Major League Baseball entered a strategic partnership with the Athletes Unlimited Softball League, a four-team women's professional softball league.

articles.title: AI Weekly: Sam Altman makes a prediction
articles.summary: Sam Altman expects big things in AI in 2026. Meta plans to fully automate advertising with AI by the end of next year. DeepSeek has updated its bot for the first time since January. ETH Zurich has developed a bot that can play badminton against humans.

articles.title: Stanford math PhD student's AI startup, Axiom, is raising $50M at $300 million valuation
articles.author: Nickie Louise
articles.summary: Stanford student Carina Hong is raising $50 million for her AI startup, Axiom. The company hasn't launched a product yet, but it's already chasing a valuation between $300 million and $500 million. It aims to develop advanced math-solving AI for quantitative and hedge funds. Hong earned degrees in math and physics at MIT, studied neuroscience at Oxford and is now a PhD student at Stanford.

articles.title: As AI PCs take over, business leaders must bolster their cybersecurity strategies, experts say
articles.author: John Kell
articles.summary: Worldwide shipments of artificial intelligence personal computers, known as AI PCs, are expected to total 114 million units this year. They are projected to represent 43% of all PC shipments in 2025. AI PCs integrate a specialized processor called a neural processing unit, or NPU, which allows laptops and desktop computers to run AI workloads directly on them. The infrastructure in these devices can more effectively handle AI tasks because they're physically closer to where the data is generated than traditional computers that send data to a cloud-based or mainframe server. Cybercriminals could add poisoned data into chatbot or generative AI applications in a bid to alter and manipulate the outputs from those tools.

articles.title: Digitate Advances Agentic AI Platform to Accelerate Enterprises Towards Autonomous, Ticketless IT and Business Operations
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: New release launches purpose-built AI agents for IT and SREs as well as AI Assistants for CIOs to tackle complex enterprise tasks. The AI agent for IT event management is now available for a free trial on Azure Monitor via Microsoft Azure Marketplace.

articles.title: Digitate Advances Agentic AI Platform to Accelerate Enterprises Towards Autonomous, Ticketless IT and Business Operations
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Digitate, a leading global SaaS provider of AIOps solutions, today announced the launch of its latest release. Built on Ignio, the new release introduces a suite of AI agents capable of handling even the most complex IT and business tasks with speed and precision.

articles.title: Google's DeepMind CEO says there are bigger risks to worry about than AI taking our jobs
articles.summary: Demis Hassabis is the CEO of Google's AI research arm DeepMind and a Nobel Prize laureate. He is worried about the misuse of AI and the loss of jobs due to it. Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei claims AI could wipe out half of entry-level white-collar jobs.

articles.title: Is the AI Companion a Failed Concept? Or Wait for Other Shoe to Drop?
articles.author: Donna Hancock
articles.summary: The tech world is abuzz with all the supposed AI technologies that we never hear the end of. There is no clear release date on these products yet. The more dangerous pieces of AI Agents are already active, so it's not a good idea to relax just yet.

articles.title: Rage against the machines: Hedge fund titan Cliff Asness ‘surrenders' to AI
articles.author: James Franey
articles.summary: Cliff Asness, 58, is worth $2 billion according to Forbes. His Connecticut-based AQR Capital Management has $136 billion in assets under management. The firm is now using machine-based algorithms powered by artificial intelligence to make its bets. Ray Dalio, the founder of the world's largest hedge fund Bridgewater Associates, warned markets not to buy all the hype surrounding artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Google delays rollout of its 'Ask Photos' AI search feature
articles.author: Amanda Silberling
articles.summary: Google is delaying the rollout of its "Ask Photos" feature for about two weeks. The product isn't up to par when it comes to latency, quality and user experience. The new version will aim to correct these issues. Google did not respond to a request for comment before publication.

articles.title: Google delays rollout of its 'Ask Photos' AI search feature
articles.author: Amanda Silberling
articles.summary: Google is delaying the rollout of its "Ask Photos" feature for about two weeks. The product isn't up to par when it comes to latency, quality and user experience. The new version will aim to correct these issues. Google did not respond to a request for comment before publication.

articles.title: Amazon to Invest $10B in North Carolina on Cloud, AI
articles.summary: Amazon.com will invest $10 billion in North Carolina to expand its artificial intelligence infrastructure. The tech giant already employs about 24,000 full- and part-time staff in the state. Amazon has invested $12 billion since 2010 in the North Carolina since 2010.

articles.title: The Washington Post Is Secretly Planning to Start Publishing Articles Created Using AI
articles.author: Noor Al-Sibai
articles.summary: Washington Post has been secretly building an AI tool called Ripple to let underqualified writers publish content in its pages. The program will be part syndication, part talent network. It will employ an "AI writing coach" called "Ember" to guide "nonprofessionals" through the article-writing process.

articles.title: The AI race we need — For a better future, not against another nation
articles.author: Ross Flint
articles.summary: Both superpowers should stop pursuing AI advances for the sake of 'beating' the other. The real race is against an unacceptable status quo: declining lifespans, increasing income inequality, intensifying climate chaos, and destabilizing politics. AI may not solve those problems but it may accelerate our ability to improve collective well-being.

articles.title: Driverless taxis taking on eerie ‘human-like behaviors' as they wreak havoc on roads – ‘impatient' move gave it away
articles.author: Michael Golson
articles.summary: Waymo's driverless taxis are taking on human-like behaviors on the road. The new findings have been discovered in the popular Waymo cars that operate in Phoenix, Arizona, San Francisco and Los Angeles California. Waymo prides itself on being safer than a regular human driver. However, the company has been involved in 696 crashes since 2021. Tesla is planning to launch its own robotaxis in Austin.

articles.title: New system allows machines to better recognize human facial expressions
articles.summary: New system allows machines to better recognize human facial expressions. ECU researchers are helping machines become more emotionally aware using a new method. The findings could influence how future emotionally aware systems are developed, such as those used in mental health support, customer service, or interactive education.

articles.title: Amazon to invest $10 billion in North Carolina data centers in AI push
articles.author: Annie Palmer
articles.summary: Amazon plans to spend $10 billion on new data centers in North Carolina to expand its artificial intelligence infrastructure. The investment will create 500 jobs in the state, the company said. Watch NBC 4 free wherever you are to stay up to date on the latest breaking news.

articles.title: Amazon to invest $10 billion in North Carolina data centers in AI push
articles.author: Annie Palmer
articles.summary: Amazon plans to spend $10 billion on new data centers in North Carolina to expand its artificial intelligence infrastructure. The company has earmarked up to $100 billion this year on capital expenditures, with the lion's share going to AI-related projects. The investment will create 500 jobs in the state.

articles.title: Amazon to invest $10 billion in North Carolina data centers in AI push
articles.author: Annie Palmer
articles.summary: Amazon plans to spend $10 billion on new data centers in North Carolina to expand its artificial intelligence infrastructure. The company has earmarked up to $100 billion this year on capital expenditures, with the lion's share going to AI-related projects. The investment will create roughly 500 jobs in the state. Amazon has announced a slew of AI products over the past year.

articles.title: Snapchat Launches Standalone Lens Studio Mobile App
articles.author: Andrew Hutchinson
articles.summary: Snap has launched a new Lens Studio mobile app. It aims to make it easier for people to build their own AR experiences. It's another step towards enabling broader creative expression with advanced digital tools. More than 400,000 professional developers and teams use Lens Studio for their creative visions.

articles.title: AI churns out funnier memes, but people still deliver the biggest laughs
articles.author: Kth Royal Institute
articles.summary: Researchers from KTH Royal Institute of Technology, LMU Munich, and TU Darmstadt conducted the first large-scale study exploring how humans and AI collaborate to create internet memes. Participants created memes using classic templates like Doge, Futurama Fry, and Boromir's iconic "One does not simply…". Participants rated the memes for creativity, humor, and shareability. Memes made entirely by AI scored higher than those made by humans or human-AI teams.

articles.title: Lockheed Introduces AI Fight Club
articles.summary: Lockheed Martin has introduced AI Fight Club, an artificial intelligence proving ground where teams of industry experts can compete to demonstrate AI-powered capabilities designed to support the Department of Defense in protecting national security. It will be completed in the third quarter of 2025. The first competition is scheduled for the fourth quarter of that year.

articles.title: Nvidia chips make gains in training largest AI systems, new data shows
articles.author: Stephen Nellis
articles.summary: Nvidia's newest chips have made gains in training large artificial intelligence systems. The number of chips required to train large language models has dropped dramatically. China's DeepSeek claims to create a competitive chatbot using far fewer chips than U.S. rivals.

articles.title: Up to 60% Off: HitPaw Father's Day Sale 2025 to Celebrate Creatively
articles.author: Hit Paw
articles.summary: HitPaw's AI tools make digital creativity simple, fun and professional-looking. They can enhance home videos, clean up old family photos, and create digital artworks from scratch using AI tools. HitPaw is available in English and in German.

articles.title: AI & Job Losses: Straws in the Wind
articles.author: Andrew Stuttaford
articles.summary: Millions of young people will graduate from college this month and look for work in industries that have little use for their skills and view them as expensive and expendable. These industries are rapidly phasing out their jobs in favor of artificial intelligence, according to Kevin Roose.

articles.title: California Senate advances AI regulation bills despite federal pushback
articles.author: Amber Coakley
articles.summary: Two California bills aimed at tightening regulation of artificial intelligence passed the state Senate this week. The bills take aim at the mental health risks of AI tools and the lack of transparency in automated decision-making systems. The two bills now move to the State Assembly and, if approved, could be on Governor Gavin Newsom's desk later this year.

articles.title: Government health chatbots hit some snags
articles.author: RUTH READER
articles.summary: Elsa is a general-purpose chatbot developed by the FDA's Center for Drug Evaluation and Research to help staff draft emails, brainstorm ideas and quickly summarize articles. The agency planned to roll it out across the agency over a week in April, but the plan was disrupted when the Trump administration downsized the FDA and laid off top tech staff.

articles.title: You Can Use ChatGPT for Looksmaxxing, but You'll Regret It
articles.summary: ChatGPT's LooksmaxxingGPT is one of the top-ranked bots in its 'Lifestyle' category. It rates your physical appearance, offers a 'PSL' (Physical Sexual Attractiveness) score, and suggests ways to improve, from makeup swaps to plastic surgery.

articles.title: Google search's AI overviews are awful, but here's a browser extension that gets rid of them
articles.author: Jeremy Laird
articles.summary: Bye, Bye Google AI is a browser extension that gets rid of AI overviews from Google search results. It works in Chrome, Edge or any desktop browser that supports Chrome extensions. It supports 19 languages and allows you to hide other areas of the Google SERP.

articles.title: You Can Use ChatGPT for Looksmaxxing, but You'll Regret It

articles.summary: ChatGPT's LooksmaxxingGPTP bot is one of the top-ranked bots in the 'Lifestyle' category. It rates your physical appearance, offers a 'PSL' (Physical Sexual Attractiveness) score, and suggests ways to improve. It has had over 700,000 conversations.

articles.title: Lawmakers should protect innovation
articles.summary: Ali Green is a Realtor with over 10 years of experience. Artificial intelligence, customer relationship management and augmented reality have transformed the real estate industry. AI and predictive analytics are reshaping client interactions. Virtual tours and AR have changed the way buyers explore properties and tools like 3D walk-throughs save clients and agents time.

articles.title: California Senate passes bill that aims to make AI chatbots safer
articles.summary: California lawmakers moved one step closer to placing guardrails around artificial intelligence-powered chatbots on Tuesday. The state legislature is considering a bill that would do that. The bill is expected to be passed in the next few days.

articles.title: Yesterday an insider told me Google had the opportunity to launch an LLM model like ChatGPT well before OpenAI did
articles.author: SGT
articles.summary: DeepMind had been working on AI for years and Google had the opportunity to launch an LLM model like ChatGPT well before OpenAI did. Google decided not to do it because it would have cannibalized Google Ads revenues and made Google Search more profitable.

articles.title: IDF veteran pitches White House on AI program that 'scans the open web for radicalization,' following the 'Israeli model' of counterterrorism.
articles.author: Nate Dog
articles.summary: Aaron Cohen, an IDF special operations veteran, has just built the first AI-powered threat. He is pitching the White House on AI program that "scans the open web for radicalization" following the "Israeli model" of counterterrorism. Ken Klippenstein shares the video on Twitter.

articles.title: Anthropic Researchers Warn That Humans Could End Up Being "Meat Robots" Controlled by AI
articles.author: Noor Al-Sibai
articles.summary: Researchers at Anthropic warn that humans may soon be little more than "meat robots" for near-future artificial intelligence systems. Sholto Douglas, who worked at Google DeepMind until earlier this year, predicts a "drop in white collar workers" in the next 2-5 years.

articles.title: Anthropic Researchers Warn That Humans Could End Up Being "Meat Robots" Controlled by AI
articles.author: Noor Al-Sibai

articles.title: Reddit sues AI company Anthropic for allegedly ‘scraping' user comments to train chatbot Claude
articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.summary: Reddit has sued the AI company Anthropic for allegedly 'scraping' user comments to train its chatbot Claude. Reddit claims that Anthropic has used automated bots to access Reddit's content despite being asked not to do so and 'intentionally trained on the personal data of Reddit users without ever requesting their consent'

articles.title: What Lies Behind AI Circumvention Tools
articles.author: Julie Bailey
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is changing our interactions with information, learning, and creative process. Many AI tools come with built-in limitations, such as ethical filters, content blocks, and programmed refusals. Bypassing AI restrictions isn't malicious, it's about seeking transparency, nuance, or depth that models might otherwise refuse to provide. GPTinf has received attention for its responsible and educational approach.

articles.title: Tennesse Tech team win top honors for 'hidden gems' app
articles.author: Emily Armstrong
articles.summary: YourTour is an AI-powered tour guide app in development by computer science students and recent graduates at Tennessee Tech University. Its AI functionality will allow the app to personalize routes and deliver curated travel suggestions based on users' interests. It aims to serve as a 'digital billboard' for hidden gems and off-the-beaten-path restaurants.

articles.summary: Digital Pathology Market Outlook 2025-2033. By the end of the forecast period, the market is expected to surpass USD 1.97 billion. The market is segmented into human pathology and veterinary pathology. Human pathology holds the dominant market share due to the growing number of cancer-related studies and rising collaborations among research institutes, healthcare institutions, and diagnostic labs. Veterinary pathology is gaining traction with increasing digitization in animal health diagnostics. Pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies dominate

In 2025, the tech industry tried to kill the bill, but it was eventually passed.
